intro: Anthodendron flavum, commonly known as the yellow anthodendron, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers, which are clustered in umbels and bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive flowers and compact growth habit.
